But point people to something and tell them it's "Baddddd" and they'll move right along, "Baddddd!" (<--- Imagine sheep noise for full effect.) "Yay! Something we get to pick on! Yay! Something we get to throw stones at!"

Case in point ... _Gigli_. I watched it recently, waiting for it to suck. "It's supposed to suck," I said. "When't it going to start sucking?" Now, I'm not saying it's _Citizen Kane_ or anything, but it's far, far from being the laughable Crap Fest that everyone says it was. It seemed like a decent Romantic ... I don't quite know what genre to put it in. It's not a Romantic Comedy because it's not trying to be funny. It's kind of a softer _Out of Sight_ or a _Get Shorty_ with a more even pace that's not trying to be a hip satire. Maybe it's just me. Maybe I have no taste. But more likely people wanted to jump on the "Dump on the Hollywood Couple That Everyone Loved to Hate" Bandwagon.

Look, _Gigli's_ not fabulous, but it's not bad. Get over yourselves. Oh, and to the guy who thought the yoga scene was overlong ... you may be right. So to save you more torture, the next time Jennifer Lopez chooses to do contortions in skin tight workout clothes while languidly discussing the wonders of the vagina, give me your ticket. Straight up, I will sit in for you. No, no. Don't thank me. It's the least I can do.

Hello. Of course, I have a theory on why so many people despise movies that have pop stars like J-Lo and Mariah Carey in them - probably because they are better off singing through the microphone, not performing in front of a camera (or in this case, "gobble-gobble"ing!) and revealing themselves on the big screen.

I think this is wrong. I am one of the very few people on earth to actually love such movies; this may be romance, but I am just trying to show that movies with pop stars "can" act. This romantic movie is the perfect start. So snuggle up to your hubby or wife (or boyfriend or girlfriend, "if" you're lucky enough to even have one!), and have a good turkey dinner as you watch the movie that is..."Gigli!" Gobble, gobble!

review_title: nowhere near as bad as people claim
review_detailed_main: this film is nowhere as bad as people claim, alright it is not fantastic and it's plot is a little dodgy. lesbian falls for Ben affleck, OK this seems to be a career pattern (implausable leading ladies!!!) but there are a hell of a lot worse movies. just put your brain into neutral and enjoy!!! this film is not Shakespeare and it does not pretend to be. it is a dodgy crime flick and non the worse for it. martin Brest (the director ) has a fantastic film inside him waiting to escape, let's not hold this against him, and one day he will dazzle us. Ben affleck for all his faults is a decent leading man (daredevil, Armageddon, bounce, chasing Amy) he just needs some decent scripts (i don't think he is capable of saving a bad script) maybe he should write them himself!! don't believe the negative press, give this a try

review_title: What is wrong with you people.
review_detailed_main: I swear that the reviews and reactions to this film are completely ridiculous. It's in a way all part of some hidden vendetta against the couple and their over publisized relationship. When it comes to films I'm one of the most critical people you will ever meet and I must say that this is a good film. Let me start this off first by saying that i usually don't enjoy films of this nature and I think with each film Jenifer Lopez becomes a better actress. I would also like to go on record as saying that my expectations were not very high and I really detest Ben Affleck. But in respect for the public I've gotta call'em like I see'em and Gigli is a keeper. The movies is completely original and although it falls into some cliches you can never tell one scene from the next. There's perfect continuinty and adequate and sexy chemistry from the two leads. Jenifer Lopez stars as Ricky an unattainable lesbian contract killer and Ben affleck whose actually pretty good stars as a contract killer. They join for a job where they have to kidnap and hold the mentally retarted brother of an important official. At this point your probably scratching your head saying whatever. But the film actually unwraps quite well. It's a lot of fun to see the sexual dialogue from the two charachters run up against eachother as they fight theie undeniable attraction. And the film although quite bleak and dark remains upbeat and heartful. I'm not saying Gigli is the best film of the year or even on the top ten. But cut the shit people and forget about the stars and give a truly entertaining and playful film a chance.

review_title: Really not as bad as they say
review_detailed_main:
I really wonder if somebody tipped off the press to just hate this movie, because Star Trek: Nemesis or A Guy Thing where (by far) a lot worst. If this movie had been with a low profile couple, I'm sure it would have had good press.

Anyway, don't listen to what the critic says, it just proves when it comes to analysing, they're definitely NOT objective. Gigli was not exceptional but it had it's good moments and was pretty cool and fun, over all.

review_title: Not as bad as it's made out to be
review_detailed_main: Had to cast a positive vote for this one because it is in serious danger of being labeled the worst movie of all time and it is not by a long shot. Granted, it's not great either but it is entertaining and all of the actors put in good performances. The writing probably could have used some help but overall this movie really was not as bad as everyone makes it out to be.

Is it really so bad. I mean I'm not saying it was the movie of the year but there's no way I think it should be in the bottom #100 either. The storyline wasn't at all bad and the acting seemed fine which I think was rated as it's biggest downfall. I think it would have been interesting to see what kind of a rating the movie got if it had starred anyone but those two. What I think happened is, is that some people got jealous of Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez and when Gigli came out and it wasn't the best movie of all time they took there chance to get them back. Then once one critic did it everyone just followed. So while I'm not saying it deserved an Oscar or to be in the top #250 I am saying that it doesn't deserve all the bad reviews it's getting.

review_title: I'm speechless. this movie is possibly the best of 2003.
review_detailed_main: I can't believe everyone hated this movie. I watched Gigli thinking it was going to be the worst movie ever made, but I was very wrong. I will think twice before labeling a movie based on a critic's reviews. Gigli combines humor with a perfect mobster atmosphere. The plot-line left a little to be desired, but it could have been worse. I know people will attack me for my comments, but I don't care. Although, if my comments are to be criticized, I hope it is by one of the other ten people that have seen the movie.

review_title: Definitely one of the better movies of the summer
review_detailed_main:
Clever story with far too much focus on the main actors. I can see why Pacino and Walken wanted to do cameos.

I'm betting that the critics took they're opinion of the actors, combined it with the preview, and then rambled on for a page to alleviate their jealous anger that they're not hot, young actors in a great movie. Granted, the last couple movies each has been in have been poorly acted and lacking anything remotely related to a decent story.

This, film, however, doesn't require either to completely carry it. The story and some extremely funny situations that make them seem like they could do comedy (which neither can) kept me interested throughout.

The writer and director deserve a huge amount of credit for coming up with a story that fit both and then letting them more or less be themselves.

Going in, I thought this was just another throw the stars together and collect the bucks movie. Turns out that it's one of the better movies of the summer.

It's one weakness is the ending. Forced, meaningless, and exposing Aflek's and Lopez's acting weaknesses. Fortunately, not long enough to ruin the rest of the film.

In the rest of the film, though, The acting came off naturally. Both essentially being the overly confident, the world revolves around me, characters they probably are in reality, but inside a story that benefits greatly from exactly that.

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen! I know why you say this is one of the first movies, It's because there is nothing really going on! But that's not why I don't like this movie, because I love it! A very happy ending (espeacially for Brain)! This movie may contain no action or heavy drama or scary horror, and there might be a bit to much coarse language, but still it's really good! Readers who haven't seen the movies, I strongly recommend you will see it! I am not joking, I was crying about the ending "sob" it's so wonderful "sob"! I don't know the other 6000 people give it a one, but my mark is a 10/10 and an A+! Thank you, I am Arthur Yanthar, your latest movie geek!

review_title: This movie was not bad at all.
review_detailed_main:
Similar to what I said about Jersey girl, people bashed this flick during J-lo and Ben's time together, because they were all tired of seeing them everywhere. This flick is pretty damn funny, and showcases J-lo's incredible sexiness. I'm not saying this should win an academy award or anything, but it's good to watch when they give it on cable, or if you have the DVD on sale. If this would have came out before they were engaged, it would've done pretty well.

I really can't explain much of the plot, because I suck at doing that without spoiling anything, but I say, check it out when they show it on cable, it's worth at least that.

This film may have got a few bad reviews but I liked it. It had a unique story and it was a pretty funny comedy. The only problem I found with this movie was that the character that Al Pacino plays should have been in the movie as one of the main cast members or have a more major part in the film. When I saw the first previews for this film I figured it was just a normal romantic comedy but when I saw Al Pacino fire a gun in the preview, I then figured it was more of a mobster movie. I really liked it though, so I give it 10 out of 10.

review_title: Don't listen to the negative comments
review_detailed_main: Well , I expected to see one of the worst movies ever as its reputation indicates. I was surprised that the movie is just amazing and funny with a really great acting from Ben and J Lo , so I loved it. I didn't understand why it received such negative critics , then I started to understand the reason. The reason is yhat many stupid people found the film offensive to the gays and lesbians. Not because it's boring, not because it's ridiculous. Only because it can be offensive to the LGBT community. That's a very ridiculous , absurd and stupid reason to hate a movie. So grow the hell up and watch the movie with an open mind. Just enjoy it.

review_title: Gigli Not As Bad As Credited

review_detailed_main: Oh man, I cannot get over how good this film was. Unbelievable! J-Lo was at her hottest and dramatic best. As for Affleck, this was 10X better than "Good Will Hunting." Throw in some cameos from Academy Award winners Al Pacino and Christopher Walken, hey, you have what we call in the industry, an epic movie. Although the story deals with hitmen and hitwomen (excuse me, Jennifer), there is also a real human element here. The film can be funny in one instant and then, one of the saddest movies you have ever seen. I think that is what makes for good drama, to be able to balance so many emotions and still tell an important story. I will be honest, I laughed quite a bit during this movie, but I cried more. I cried like a baby, because the chemistry of Ben and J-Lo was that damn good. I know it is early to start talking Academy, but it must be addressed. I really have to admonish the studio for releasing this film now, it should have had a winter or Spring release, so as to be fresh on the mind of Oscar. However, I don't think Oscar will soon forget this magical motion picture. Do yourself a favor and see it, do yourself a bigger favor and see it again. Citizen Kane, you now have a rival!

review_title: Most hated film but not the worst
Not As bad as everyone says
review_detailed_main: Ben and Jennifer's chemistry is undeniable. Some funny moments.

review_title: Not as bad as expected, pretty good!
review_detailed_main: I think most of the negative reviews were from people who were expecting a blockbuster movie due to all the big stars in the movie. It was a bit slow but not all romcoms are fast paced. I thought it was a very enjoyable Sunday afternoon flick. The characters developed as the movie went on and went from unlikable to likable. I wish Walken had a bigger role so that was a mystery. Pacino was great. The actor who played the abducted brother (name escapes me) was amazing. Afleck was good as usual. Jlo was sexy and charming. A bit unbelievable as a lesbian gangster but hey, it's Hollywood. She always plays a great lead romantic interest even though in this film she was a sometines flirtatious lesbian. There was comedy and heartfelt drama. I would watch it again.

This movie has been given the shaft by a million dumb critics and sheeplike audience members who jump on the buzzwagon for dear life. The movie is far from great; it's not even "good," in the most literal meaning of that word. But it has some scenes which are indelible and literate and beautifully acted, most notable J.Lo's "vagina monologue," which is the best acting she's ever done and one of the most delightful movie scenes of the year. The movie as a whole is uneven but more entertaining than most movies in the unholy cinema year of 2003. If I could have the two hours I spend with "Bruce Almighty" back again, I might spend them reseeing "Gigli."

review_title: Not quite the worst movie ever made
If people call this bad, they don't know what bad is!
review_detailed_main:
I actually thought this had some really good dialogue and it wasn't nearly as bad as it's reputation would have us believe. It was actually pretty good. In fact, I would give it a higher rating, except that I wasn't expecting a couple violent scenes, which almost ruined it for me. But then, it was redeemed in the end by a certain scene on the beach with the autistic boy, which proves that God works in mysterious ways! I immediately had the feeling upon seeing that, but whoever wrote it was divinely inspired, whether they realized it or not. Because things like that do happen in life. They are called Godwinks.

And, just like Jennifer Lopez in the movies says, guys usually don't do it for me, but Ben Affleck in this film somehow manages to be an exception. What a pretty boy! He reminds me a lot of Joan Jett's brother. I watched this movie for Jennifer lopez, and I ended up especially enamored with Ben Affleck! Go figure! That being said, Jennifer Lopez was quite a looker herself in this film. I was quite fond of her updos in this film as well.

The only cons that I really can think of about this movie is that it's an r-rated rom-com, and I'm not fond of any romantic comedy that is r-rated. Although, this, along with Jennifer Lopez's other r-rated romantic comedy, shotgun wedding, is very good. But they would be much better if they were PG or PG-13 at the most. That being said, this movie isn't nearly as bad as people say it is, and I rather enjoyed it.

The kidnapped brother was annoying to me until about a quarter of the way through, and then he started to be more endearing. By that point, I started to enjoy the movie itself overall.

Gigli is magnificant. I can't say a bad thing about it. This film should and will sweep the board at the oscars undoubtedly. Ben Affleck deserves special praise for his truely flawless performance and his gal J- Lo didnt do half bad either. I urge you to see this film immediately.

Gigli really had me rocking' in my socks. This movie is the best gangster movie since the Godfather, and honestly this movie is even better than the Godfather Pt. 1 through 3. This movie blows Scarface, Goodfellas, and yes, anything Scorsese has ever done. This is a true cinematic masterpiece! Pacino and Afflack shine. Pacino's second best role, next to Godfather III! If you want to live the high life, watch Gigli! You'll appreciate so much in life, and hell, you might even want to date a Puerto Rican lesbian with a butt the size of Africa! Ben Afflack is in attack mode again, this time not as Daredevil (his second best movie to this). If you enjoy those flick, also check out Get Rich or Die Trying and you might want to see Spartan starring Val Kilmer for a similar ride in cinematic excellence. The ending to this movie is truly orgasmic, and is exciting along the lines to The Road Warrior or even Scarface. Watch out for a cameo from Adam Sandler and Mike Myers too!

review_title: I think that most people who gave it a 1 never saw the movie
review_detailed_main:
At the time this was released Bennifer (as they were called) were all over the press non-stop and I think that annoyed people and made some give it a 1 just because it turned into a fad doing so, a lot without seeing it before (similar to THE INTERVIEW where people gave it a 10 because they claimed threats from North Korea if releasing it)

This was before Ben Affleck was a respected actor and filmmaker in Hollywood, he was sort of the laughing stock around those days (unfairly IMO but such it was)

And I think a lot of people went into the movie just looking for flaws, and yes this movie has flaws but if you go into a movie looking for flaws how could you possibly enjoy the rest of it?

And I strongly think the positives outweighs the negatives

And maybe they were expecting a action-comedy? I know that the Swedish DVD I own has it listed as a action-comedy with J Lo and Ben both carrying guns on the cover

This is NOT a action-movie, it's a feel-good drama-comedy really, and a darn good one too if you ask me

Positives:

-Entertaining performances from J Lo and Ben -Funny dialog for the morepart -Nice well-played dramatic moments as well -Awfully underrated performance from Justin Bartha -Killer soundtrack -Good coming of age story -Jennifer Lopez is more stunning than ever

Negatives:

-Christopher Walkens super-bizarre 2 scene performance where he pronounces words very oddly -The sex talk which there is a lot of can at times admittedly be a little cringe-worthy -Affleck and especially Lopez are a little too nice to be truly believable as tough criminals

But yeah that's about it overall a very enjoyable movie and laugh at me if you want but I usually cry a teardrop or 2 in the end of the movie

review_title: This is a good movie, despite what others say.
I will commit suicide if J-Lo does not get the Oscar.
review_detailed_main: GIGLI...GIGLI...GIGLI..GIGLI! One cannot roll that silky name off the tongue enough times to be satisfied. The hallowed actress of our generation, Jennifer Lopez, delivers a stellar performance as a classy socialite coming to terms with her true sexual identity. If this does not deserve the ACADEMY AWARD, nothing does. Most people who have perused my reviews know I judge a film on its integrity and longevity. "It's turkey time!" ::Gobble:: ::Gobble:: - An instant catchphrase if I ever heard one; just wait until this enters the mainstream lexicon. There were points in this film when I had to pause it and search the DVD cover for the name Arthur Miller. I hope generations to come will base their every view of us upon this film.

Thought the above comments were somewhat harsh. Perhaps it's because I fell in love with J Lo during this movie. Never really rated her before but she looks stunning in virtually every scene. Just be prepared to suspend disbelief and go along with it. And if this is the commencement of token lesbians in films then it can't be all that bad ;-)

Not a film I would go out of my way to see again but I would recommend it as a good watch. The acting wasn't too bad I thought; there was a distinct spark when she asks Ben a heartfelt question. Ultimately a feel good movie. Shame about the last couple of lines though - bubble poppers if ever there were any.

review_title: Not as bad as people are telling you it is.

review_detailed_main: I just saw this movie, and I think it's good. There's no way this is the worst movie ever made, and I don't think it should belong to the bottom 100 films. Ben and J-Lo were great. Ben is cool, and J-Lo is hot, and the movie isn't bad. I give it 8/10.

This wasn't the worst movie i've ever seen. It's not even a BAD movie. I thought it was relatively enjoyable. Don't comment on the movie unless you've seen it. I can tell some people on here haven't seen it. I would give the movie a four on my scale. like Ebert said 2.5 stars. Not good , but certainly not terrible.

Yeah, everyone jumped on the bandwagon--hate the two lovers and hate the film, and it snowballed into a nationwide hate fest. Ridiculous how bad the reviews are for this film. It's been criticized for the plot...hell, it's a goofy comedy, so why is everyone tearing the silly plot to pieces, when most other comedies have stupid plots. It's been faulted for the screenplay, but it's not that terrible...there are some clever lines here, certainly enough to warrant the movie's existence. And, of course, everyone hates the way Ben and Lo act, yet their acting comes off fine--they goof off one another and have fun with the confrontations.

For some reason this film has been put under the microscope and shot to hell. But crazy me, I actually enjoyed the film. Oh well.

review_title: Probably The Most Underrated Movie Ever... Seriously...
review_detailed_main:
I (unlike 50% of the 2,000 people who gave this movie a 1) saw

this movie, and let me just say that this was the best movie of the

year (yes, better than PoTC). I can't believe why people gave it a 1

(possibly because they are sick of J Lo and Ben?). First off, the

movie was advertised horribly wrong, and because of that, the

movie suffered at the box office. I'm dissapointed beyond belief at

this point. Why don't you people see the movie before you judge it?

I used to love IMDB, but now I just can't stand it. See Gigli, it is a

truly terrific film.

The acting is amazing (even J. Lo is excellent). The story is great,

and the supporting cast is phenomenal. Go see it!!!!!!!! It truly is

one of the best of the year if not ever. I admit that when I saw the

preview, I thought it looked horrible, but after I actually watched the

film I was stunned at how amazingly good it was. 10/10 seriously.

review_title: Gigli is a triumph of the spirit
review_detailed_main: I don't know how come everyone is saying bad things about Gigli,like that it's "bad" or "not good" or "crappy." Gigli is so good. It's the funny, it got the romance, it has the suspense and the drama and also the lesbianism. It is a good movie for kids of all ages and also for people that had monkey brain transplants or even had their brain surgeried by monkey doctors. If Gigli was a salad dressing it would probably be sun-dried tomato, or maybe something with a lot of garlic. You know why? Because Gigli packs a little zing, as they say in the business, and also in high doses Gigli can hurt your mouth or give you halitosis. If Gigli was a sandwich, it would be one of those really rare super awesome sandwiches that make all the other sandwiches you normally eat look like second rate amateur sandwiches, or maybe poo sandwiches. Gigli is a spicy treat, aptly seasoned and cooked to perfection as though television's own Emeril Lagassi whipped up one of his signature dishes and then said "That's a Spicy Meatball!" Except Gigli is no meatball, it's just one heck of motion picture.

When I rented this movie I didn't expect anything of it but I was surprised and found this movie very watchable. This movie was definitely better than J-lo's enough which was a dud. My advice to all of you is that watch this movie with low expectations and you will like it. Just ignore the acting of Ben and Jen. They are not up to the mark.

My rating 7/10

review_title: Not sure why it is so bad for others and not for me??!!
review_detailed_main: Movie lacks a plot, yes. Movie lacks main stream theme, yes., but does it lack anything else, No. Are there mistakes, yes but there are several movies which are rated 6-7 and lack almost similar things with added disadvantage that they have bad dialogs and acting. Acting in the movie is very good and is almost at best level. Making of movie is of top level. I can only say someone somewhere lost some interest. It has some very profound dialogs which only less than one percent of the population can understand. May be that is the reason that people could not like it. It leaves you dangling at the end but why cannot we read love all over flowing in the eyes than being told with explicit scenes. Jennifer is not convincing as lesbian, she is too hot, I admin if this portrayal wrecked the movie unconsciously, may be. If you watch this movie with full disdain for plot then there is nothing wrong with the movie. Just watch with a moving window of ten minutes story and you will feel the power of absurdity with which people have thrown this gem away. I am going to watch this movie couple of times to really understand what is bad.

The movie was a lot funnier then I thought it would be. J Lo still isn't a great actor, but she's getting better. Ben Affleck was funny as could be. Although there were some scenes in the movie that had errors(which there is always bound to be), it was all around very good. Although it was pretty funny, it's not a first run theater movie, wait for a cheap theater or for it to come out on video.

i think this film is funny and i like it. i did not see the movie in the theater,because of the bad reviews.in the case of the movie :The Village its the same;great movie.

now i saw the movie in the German pay TV channel. as a German it don't bother me that the theme of the movie is:lesbian,gangster and special people. in Germany such things be normal,an the most people be liberate. the dialog in the movie and the acting is good. I think the movie stands in the tradition of:Pulp Fiction Reservoir Dogs Get Shorty Give the movie a chance,see it then give your vote. The actors such as Cristopher Walken and Al Pacino be well selected.

review_title: The Perfect movie, Bennifer 2.0 on it's way.
review_detailed_main:
The Perfect movie, Bennifer 2.0 on it's way.

The Perfect movie, Bennifer 2.0 on it's way.

I was captivated and eventually rewarded by watching Gigli

Its obvious the lets-jump-on-the-bandwagon effect kicked in and Ben and JLo have always been one of those love-to-hate celebraties!

But looking beyond this I found an interesting film Yes, its slow, very slow moving to start with and the plot is ethereal but I'm a huge fan of Easy Rider, Waking Life and other films without an obvious plot so I found Gigli captivating from the start

By the end of the film I was glad to see they had avoided stupid car chases and fight scenes which would have got in the way of the flow

Ultimately this is a love story and all other aspects of the story are secondary, sure characters come and go but that doesn't matter, its not the point

The commentry on male ego and the nature of our society is enlightening and thought provoking. Its an uplifting film at heart

Its also obviously an adventureous movie and it shows, some of the interaction scenes are comical, sometimes there are way too many words used and you start smiling. Reading from a Tabasco sauce bottle was too much! Was this intentional? I'm not sure but I found it funny and you don't often get that with stream of consciousness type movies I don't know how to describe it but there is an aura about Gigli that I ended up enjoying Being an optimist I put down any faults simply to naivity, and this is not necessarily always a bad thing

It reminded me of Buffalo 66 In this film a convict kidnaps a girl and they end up falling in love

What can I say? This film worked for me!

The film Gigli has been critically panned over the last few years and i decided that i should write one of the few positive reviews.

Gigli, directed by Martin Brest (Beverly Hills Cop, Scent of a Woman) is a romantic comedy about criminals with a heart. This is a plot that has been done before, a criminal (or two in this case) begins doubting his/her life after being ordered to do a certain job.

Now, that makes it an average gangster film, but this is a romantic comedy. Basically the two criminals (played by Ben Affleck and Jeniffer Lopez) fall in love on a job (babysitting a mentally handicapped young man) this results in a hearty amount of laughs, interesting cameos, tarrantinoesque dialog etc.

The way i see this movie, a perfectly acceptable (if not above average) romantic comedy. Panned by critics only because of the stars (who wern't that bad at acting).

My advice, rent this movie, sit back relax, and laugh.

review_title: Its not that bad. No, really
review_detailed_main:
***Zillions of SPOILERS***

Watched this about three times last week, and that's not because I lost a bet or am, as Baby Jane Hudson suggested, in a place where 'they can look after me.'

I actually don't like either of the lead actors and was naturally as bored with the coverage of their quasi-relationship as the rest of humanity (that probably included animal life) but that's why televisions come with remotes.

I think this movie took a beating because of the off-screen thing, and that's unfair. Now that some time has passed, maybe that's why its worth defending to a certain degree. I've seen MUCH worse movies, seen two leads have MUCH less chemistry and certainly listened to worse dialogue (although it IS profoundly over-written at times but I'd rather listen to that than having to hear cliché-ridden, idiot-plex-pleasing garbage).

Ben plays Larry Gigli, who works for Nick. Nick kindly requests Larry kidnap Brian, the mentally-challenged brother of a federal prosecutor, in hopes that the prosecutor will no longer do his job on behalf of an associate of Nicks. Unbeknownst to Larry, Nick also assigns Ricky (Lopez) to this particular case so they can keep an eye on each other and on Brian. Larry is insulted that a woman has been put in place to question his authority and professionalism, because he's a self-described 'gangster's gangster' and has the Henry Hill/Chili Palmer wardrobe to prove it. Since Ricky is not leaving, he invited her to share his bed and when he makes a move on her, she rejects him cause she's gay. They then spend a good deal of time pointing out the pluses and minuses of the male and female sex organs and their own preferences, but naturally there's an attraction between them.

She rejects him with her words but her face indicates otherwise. She also accuses him of being gay, which infuriates him of course.

Various other people enter the story at different points - Larry's mother, played by a funny Lainie Kazan; Ricky's lover, and Chris Walken, whose five minute cameo serves only to annoy. Then there's Al Pacino, who seems to be re-working Tony Montana by way of Truman Capote.

Affleck is at his best, for me, when he's being emotionally generous and vulnerable. When he expresses his frustration at having a beautiful, unavailable woman in his bed, he expresses it in a very macho way but you know he could shed a tear at any moment. Similar to a scene from "Chasing Amy" which happens in a car also. But this time its funny and sad at the same time.

I did learn some things watching this movie. I learned you can remove at thumb from a corpse with a plastic butter knife....? I learned the difference between answering a question with the answer 'yes' or the answer 'sure.' I learned how men are supposed to check if their fingernails need trimming.

Its not all good. But I'm not getting into specifics since as I've pointed out, this movie has already taken too much of an unfair beating already. 8/10.

I, like everyone else heard the awful rumors about this movie. So my neighbor comes homes one day with a screener copy of the movie as the movie was still playing in the theatre. So I borrowed it not wanting to waste money in the theatre. I started to watch it and was dying half way through the movie, then my neighborhood had a black out so I coudnt finish it that night.. The next day I told my brother how funny it was and that I liked it so much I wanted to finish it off in the theatre. I never actually made it to the theatre but did finish the DVD the next day. I really liked it and found it to be hilarious, however, I can see why someone wouldn't like it. The story doesn't really go anywhere but hey, it entertained me and made me laugh. Also the screener copy I have is different from the actual released DVD you can buy... The screener has a totally different ending... J-Lo isn't really Ricki. She's Rickies roommate, and she isn't a contractor. So all along Ben is listening to her with advice (The cutting off the thumb) and she has never even done anything like this... From what I remember, she just spoke to the boss over the phone and he assumed she was Ricki and she went with it. The official movie has her really being a contractor. Also in the screener, there's a scene where Ben baseball bats some guys car. That was pretty cool. I like the screener better but both versions are hilarious. Not for everyone but certainly for me.

I gave it a 10 out of 10 because this does not deserve 2/10. Probably 5 or 6/10. I've watched a few movies lately from this era where viewers expected more than was aimed at them. Take it for what it is and it ain't so bad :P

The guy with the retard roll was excellent, as good as I am Sam I though. Possibly more of a chick flick but as a guy I thought it was OK but lacking. Jen was pretty hot at the time :)
The start was terrible, the middle was woeful and the less said about the ending the better, possible the worst movie ever made. But I'm sure they meant well....10 stars!!!!!!
